ch.aplu.nxtsim

Class Motor

  • java.lang.Object
    • ch.aplu.jgamegrid.Actor
      • ch.aplu.nxtsim.Part
        • ch.aplu.nxtsim.Motor
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ch.aplu.jgamegrid.GGActorCollisionListener, ch.aplu.jgamegrid.GGBorderListener, ch.aplu.jgamegrid.GGTileCollisionListener, java.util.EventListener

    public class Motor
extends Part
    Class that represents one of the NXT motors.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Motor

        public Motor(MotorPort port)
        Creates a motor instance that is plugged into given port.
        Parameters:
        port - the port where the motor is plugged-in (MotorPort.A, MotorPort.B, MotorPort.C)

    • Method Detail

      • forward

        public Motor forward()
        Starts the forward rotation. Method returns immediately, while the rotation continues.
        Returns:
        the object reference to allow method chaining

      • backward

        public Motor backward()
        Starts the backward rotation. Method returns immediately, while the rotation continues.
        Returns:
        the object reference to allow method chaining

      • stop

        public Motor stop()
        Stops the rotation.
        Returns:
        the object reference to allow method chaining

      • setSpeed

        public Motor setSpeed(int speed)
        Sets the speed to the given value (arbitrary units).
        Parameters:
        speed - the speed 0..100
        Returns:
        the object reference to allow method chaining

      • getSpeed

        public int getSpeed()
        Returns the current speed (arbitrary units).
        Returns:
        the speed 0..100

      • getPort

        public MotorPort getPort()
        Returns the port of the motor.
        Returns:
        the motor port

      • isMoving

        public boolean isMoving()
        Checks if motor is rotating. Calls Thread.sleep(1) to prevent CPU overload in close polling loops.
        Returns:
        true, if motor is rotating; otherwise false
